You should give feedback directly to the person it concerns. Their manager or their mother is not going to act on the feedback, the person themselves must do it. Professionals give each other direct feedback and only escalate to their manager if they can't resolve it among themselves.
How should I give feedback?

You can use the 'I-I-You' method to give feedback: 1. 'I notice that...' [describe the behavior: what exactly did you see/hear?] 2. 'I think that...'/'That comes across to me as...' [effect of this behavior on you: what is bothering you?] 3. 'Do you recognize that? Is that correct?' [seek connection with the other person and ask for recognition; if the other person becomes defensive, go back to steps 1 and 2] 4. Ask for different behavior. [what is your wish?]
How should I receive feedback?

When receiving feedback: 1. Listen to the feedback without defending yourself. 2. Ask for clarification on what the other person means. 3. Confirm receipt by summarizing. 4. Reflect on feelings: what you suspect the other person feels and how you feel. 5. Tell what you will do with the feedback, if anything. 6. Evaluate the feedback. You decide whether or not to do something with it. 7. Thank the person who gave the feedback.
What is the protocol for answering the office phone?

In the office, there are several landline phones that customers can reach via 020-3318177. Since 2018, they encounter a phone menu: 1 for Support, 2 for Sales. If nothing (or a name/number) is displayed, it's someone for Support, and the person who is Team Support that day picks up first. If 'Sales' is displayed, a Project Manager will answer. If the phone has rung 2-3 times and no one has responded, pick it up! Say, 'Good day, this is Van Ons [and then your name]'.
What should I do if I can't help the caller directly?

If you can't help the caller directly, ask who the call is intended for, note the name and phone number, and pass on the information. If you can't understand the caller well, simply ask them to repeat until you have written down the correct details. This is very important because if we can't call back, it's very frustrating and we might miss potential business.
How should I handle complex social interactions over the phone?

Here are some tips to help you navigate complex social interactions over the phone: 1. If someone thinks we are 'from WordPress', patiently explain the difference between the brilliant work we do and the basic CMS system that is WordPress. 2. If someone calls for a colleague, note the name and phone number and leave a note on the colleague's desk. 3. If someone calls because they want to build a new website, check if one of the Project Managers is around to take over the conversation. If not, ask the person to send an email to a Project Manager, preferably with a briefing. 4. Always stay nice, don't lose your patience, and don't forget: 'leave emotion at the door'.
What are the internal communication channels for the Van Ons team?

For internal communication during the workday, the Van Ons team uses Slack (https://vanons.slack.com). For urgent or practical messages important to the entire company, there's a WhatsApp group called 'Van Ons liefde'. Ask Robert for an invite. For messages important to the entire company, there's also an Intranet.
What are the external communication channels for customers to reach Van Ons?

Customers can reach Van Ons through the following external communication channels: 1. By phone at 020 331 81 77. See also: telephone etiquette. 2. Via email, often directly to a Project Manager or through info@van-ons.nl and the form on https://van-ons.nl. 3. Via support@van-ons.nl (Help Scout). See also: Support.
What are the conditions for deploying a website?

A website can be deployed (go live) if: 1. It's Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday. 2. Preferably as early as possible in the day, but definitely not after 2:00 PM. 3. It's not a day directly before a national holiday or a day when you're off work the next day.
What are the different ways of going live?

There are three different ways of going live: 1. Live on a new URL (maintenance mode off). 2. Live with new hosting (switching the DNS). 3. Live with a new design for an existing WooCommerce shop. Each method has its own preparation steps and procedures.
What are the preparations for every live launch?

Before every live launch, you should: 1. Copy the Website Checklist in Google Drive and place the copy in the project folder. 2. Follow all the steps in the checklist, including creating a backup of the old website (if applicable).
What is the procedure for going live on a new URL?

To go live on a new URL: 1. The website can already be set up on the correct environment. Use a plugin like WP Maintenance Mode to shield it from the public until it's ready to go live. 2. Send the client an email with your approach and the 'live launch procedure'. Verify by phone that they have seen and understood the email. 3. Before and after disabling Maintenance Mode, go through the checklist. 4. Make sure that under Settings > Reading, the option to discourage search engines is unchecked. 5. Go live!
What is the procedure for going live with new hosting?

To go live with new hosting: 1. Determine who manages the DNS. If the domain name is with us, it's easy. Otherwise, it's usually with a party that only the client can access. 2. Ensure the TTL (time to live) is as low as possible. 3. Make sure you know how the client's email is set up. 4. Ask the client explicitly if everything on the environment that will go live is satisfactory. 5. Send the client an email with the explanation of the procedure and what you will do if something goes wrong. 6. Give the client a time and day after which they should not work on the live site. 7. Go live and check if everything works as desired.
What is the procedure for going live with a new design for an existing WooCommerce shop?

The procedure for going live with a new design for an existing WooCommerce shop is not provided in the text. However, it's mentioned that you should avoid transferring content back and forth via the database, as it may cause issues with orders linked to both products and customers. It's recommended to follow the other live launch procedures and adapt them to the specific needs of a WooCommerce shop.
What does it mean to redesign a WooCommerce shop live?

Redesigning a WooCommerce shop live means making changes to the website while it's still accessible to the public. This method is risky because you're working on a live site, so there's a time pressure. The site needs to be available again as quickly as possible.
What are the steps involved in this process?

The process involves several steps, including preparing the client, uploading the new theme and necessary plugins to the live site, activating the themes and plugins, checking everything works, making the desired settings in WordPress, theme, and plugins, and finally, confirming with the client that everything is working correctly.
What happens if something goes wrong during the live setting?

If something goes wrong during the live setting, such as encountering errors in functionality or content, a rollback is desired. In that case, a new date will be set for the live setting. The old theme and necessary plugins will be reactivated, and the old site will be back.
What precautions are taken to ensure the live setting goes smoothly?

Several precautions are taken to ensure a smooth live setting. These include making sure the client knows what we're going to do and what will happen if the live setting doesn't go well, scheduling a day when the client has time to sit behind the computer, and making sure the site itself is 100% satisfactory on dev or staging before the live setting.
What should I consider when copying content for a new website?

When copying content for a new website, you should consider potential privacy-sensitive information that may be embedded in the website. This could include form submissions, orders if it's an e-commerce site, and existing users. It's important to discuss with the client where in the content such information may be located and ensure it's not copied.
What is SVN and how does it relate to WordPress?

SVN, or Subversion, is a version control system that WordPress uses for deploying plugin versions. It's similar to GIT, another version control system. The main difference is that SVN is purely a 'release repository', while GIT is also used to push small changes. WordPress has indicated a desire to switch to GIT in the future, but for now, SVN is still in use.
How do I deploy a new version using SVN?

To deploy a new version using SVN, you first need to fetch the existing repository. Then, update your local SVN version to ensure it's up-to-date. Add the latest code to the /trunk/ folder, let SVN know about this code, and then push your code to the SVN repository. Finally, tag the new version and commit the version to the repository.
What should I do if I have a question during this process?

If you have any questions during this process, you can consult with your team lead or refer to the WordPress documentation. It's important to ensure you understand each step to avoid any potential issues.
What is a 'Kut goal' in table football?
A 'Kut goal', also known as a 'Lame goal', in table football is a goal made by the midfield or a goal where the ball hits a side and/or player(s) (excluding the goalkeeper) on its way to the goal.
What does 'Streep' mean in table football?
'Streep' in table football refers to a shot on goal that does not change direction on its way to the goal due to hitting a side, a defender, a midfielder, or an attacker.
What is a 'SPIN' in table football?
'SPIN', or 'Spinnen', in table football refers to a rotating movement of a rod, to which the players are attached, of more than 360 degrees.
What is an 'Eigen goal' in table football?

An 'Eigen goal', also known as an 'Eigen doelpunt' or 'dom', in table football is when a player, intentionally or unintentionally, shoots or pushes the ball into their own goal. This does not apply when a ball changes direction due to a shot from the opponent.
What is a 'Klinker' in table football?

A 'Klinker' in table football is a goal where the ball goes into the goal and then immediately bounces back into the field. The ball must have completely crossed the line, into the goal, hit the back of the goal, and then completely crossed the line, out of the goal.
What does 'BOEM' mean in table football?
'BOEM' in table football is a sound effect for a shot. It's used to add a bit of fun and excitement to the game.
What are the rules for scoring a goal in table football?

In table football, a goal counts only if it results from a shot or a block where the ball goes straight into the goal, referred to as a 'Streep'. However, a goal does not count if it results from a shot or block by a midfielder, if it results from a spinning shot, referred to as a 'SPIN', or if it's an own goal.
How are points awarded in table football?

In table football, all goals score 1 point, unless otherwise mentioned in the bonus points list. For instance, a 'Klinker', which is a goal where the ball goes into the goal and then immediately bounces back into the field, scores an extra point. The scoring team can choose to either add this extra point to their own score or subtract it from the opponent's score. However, the score can never go below zero.
How do I access external design files in Figma?
To access external design files in Figma that were not created by Van Ons, you can ask the client to grant access to the design by sharing it with design@van-ons.nl.
How do I create a project in Figma?

To create a project in Figma, first, log in with the Van Ons account. On the side panel, you'll see 'Teams', and you should work within the 'Van Ons' team. Hover your mouse over the 'Van Ons' name, and a '+' icon will appear. Click on it to create a new project. Name the project after the client or the party involved, and you can even add a fun emoji for a personal touch.
How do I create a document in Figma?

Within a Figma project, you can create various design files. When creating a design file, make sure to include multiple pages. The standard pages we use are: 'Design', where the actual design work takes place; 'Assets', where all reusable components are placed; 'Presentation', where pages to be shared with the client are placed; and '_Thumbnail', where the project thumbnail for our own Figma is placed.
How do I share a design with a client in Figma?

To share a design with a client in Figma, open the Figma file on the 'Presentation' page, start a presentation using the arrow button in the top right corner, and share the presentation link with the client. During the design process, the client should not have access to the full file. However, you may grant them access to the full file at the end of the project if needed.
What is the branch setup for IDB?

IDB has a unique branch setup. There's a ticket branch for each JIRA ticket, a develop branch for testing, a staging branch for client testing, and a master branch for production. The flow is usually from staging to dev/IDB-XXXX, then to develop, staging, and finally master.
What is the procedure for hotfixes?
Hotfixes follow a different procedure. The feature branch should branch off from the master branch. The order is: master -> dev/IDB-XXXX -> hotfix -> master -> develop.
How do you handle commits from external parties?
IDB sometimes works with freelance programmers who may make changes to our code. We only accept these changes via a diff file, which can be applied with Sourcetree or a Git command.
What is the deployment process?
Each city/site has its own pipeline in Buddy, configured to run deploy scripts and compile CSS/JS on each deploy. When a new city/site is added, a pipeline needs to be set up as well.
What is the testing process?

Every ticket needs to be tested before it is merged to staging. After finalizing a ticket, it needs to be merged into the develop branch. This will be deployed to the test site, where the tester can check if the ticket is fully resolved and no issues have emerged. When the ticket is approved, the ticket branch is merged into the staging branch for client testing.
How do you set up a new IDB site?
When creating a new IDB site, there's a specific guide to follow for the proper setup. You can find this guide on Google Drive.
How do I open the office?

The office can be accessed at any time with a single key that opens the front door and the doors to the floors. For example, if you've forgotten something, you can always get in as there is no alarm system.
What should I do when I am the last one to leave the office?

If you're the last one leaving the office, it's important to secure the premises. Check all floors to ensure all windows are closed and lights are turned off. Also, make sure all doors are closed and locked. Turn the key until it can't turn anymore. Finally, lock the front door as you leave.
Why the cow?

The cow is related to the founders Bas and Robert, who are from Haarlemmermeerpolder, an area with few cows but with the potential for cows. The cow is memorable and serves as a marketing tool for the company.
Why WordPress?

Although the company is not solely a WordPress agency anymore, they have over 10 years of experience with this CMS. WordPress is used by over 30% of the internet, making it the most popular content management system. The company builds on top of this platform.
What do you expect from me?

Expectations are communicated through personal talks, and there is reading material available on the subject, such as Mission Statements for Developers and Competencies for developers. Knowing expectations helps you understand how to thrive and excel in your role.
How do I make a suggestion?

To make a suggestion, speak up whenever you get the chance. Approach other team members, set up a meeting, and share your ideas. The company appreciates and welcomes new approaches and suggestions from its employees.
Who owns Van Ons?
Van Ons was founded by Bas and Robert. Together with Brian Hirman (advisor) and Jeffrey Visser, they are the shareholders of Van Ons Holding B.V., which owns Van Ons B.V. (the agency).
What should I do when leaving the office?
When leaving the office, check if there are other colleagues and ensure all doors on all floors are locked. Lock each door by turning the key multiple times. Simply closing the door is not enough.
What are the guidelines for absence, holidays, and other days off?
Please read the guidelines regarding absence, holidays, and other days off in the document titled 'Sick, vacation and late'.
What are the rules for office parties?
All office parties (borrels) at the office end at 22:00. Please leave the office at 22:00, clean if necessary, and continue the fun in the city.
What is the dress code at the office?

The dress code is business casual. This is important as customers make decisions about the quality of our services based on their interaction with you. Your outfit should be clean, wrinkle-free, and professional. For men, jeans or trousers are suggested, but no zip-off or cargo pants. Shorts are allowed on Van Ons HQ premises, but not when visiting a client.
What should I avoid wearing?

Please avoid wearing sleeveless tops where your armpit hair is showing. Flip flops, slippers, full-kit tracksuits, 'joggingbroeken', and 'huispakken' are prohibited. When you have a meeting with a client, you should wear closed shoes.
Can I wear sportswear or headgear?
Sportswear is generally prohibited, with the exception of sports shoes or a jersey. As for headgear, hats or other types are fine and can even add a fun element to your outfit.
What does it mean that the planning is 'sacred'?

When we say the planning is 'sacred', we mean that it is the leading factor when there are urgent requests or discussions about when tasks should be done. The planning is carefully thought out each week to ensure the entire agency's schedule is accurate. Last-minute changes can disrupt this, unless it's an emergency or a better result can be achieved through discussion.
How is the estimated time for a project managed?

A Producer inputs the estimated time for a project into Forecast. Every week, all Producers and the Operations Manager have a meeting about this. Depending on the most recent client and development wishes and urgent requests, adjustments can be made. During the ongoing week, adjustments are minimized, but sometimes they are necessary.
What is the policy for support and emergency situations?

For situations that exceed the planned time, a Developer has a maximum of 30 minutes available each day for Support and emergencies. If more than 30 minutes is needed, a discussion with a Producer is required.
How many projects should a Developer work on in a day?
In an ideal world, Developers work on no more than 2 projects per day. Producers try to sell hours in blocks of 4 hours (half a day) as much as possible to achieve this.

Setting up the email signature in Apple Mail requires more effort. You can follow the instructions provided in this guide: http://matt.coneybeare.me/how-to-make-an-html-signature-in-apple-mail-for-mojave-os-x-10-dot-14/
What are the fire escape routes in the building?

In case of fire, you can exit the building through the front door or the skylight on the 3rd floor. You can then climb onto the roof and over the fence to a safe place. Remember, do not use the elevator in case of fire.
How do I find out where a site is hosted?
You can find this information in the hosting sheet.
How do I know which WordPress plugin is used on a site?

You can log in to ManageWP with an account that has full access. Go to the overview of all websites, select all websites, and then click on the 'Plugins' button (possibly hidden under 'Tools'). This will give you a complete overview of all installed plugins.
Where can I find the QR code for two-step verification of a shared account?
These QR codes are collected in a Drive folder. Robert and Jeffrey have access to this folder.
How do we handle sending emails from a site?

For sending emails from a site, we use Mandrill. We offer this service for free to our customers who do not send a lot of emails. To set up a new site with Mandrill, you need to log in to Mandrill, add the domain of the sending email address, create an API key for the site, install the WP Mail SMTP plugin, and configure the plugin with the Mandrill settings.
What does the project evaluation process look like?

The project evaluation process consists of three main parts. First, a review of the final result and the current status of the project. Second, an analysis of the process, discussing what went well and what could be improved, often focusing on communication, the briefing, and collaboration. Third, a discussion of specific project components that require extra attention, such as design, customer feedback, and the hours worked in relation to what was delivered. The goal is to learn from each project, so it's important to be honest, well-prepared, and to share the meeting minutes with all involved parties, including the Technical Lead and Project Managers.
What should I focus on when preparing for a project evaluation?

When preparing for a project evaluation, you should focus on the key areas that will be discussed. This includes the final result of the project, the process you followed, and specific aspects of the project that required extra attention. Reflect on what went well and what could be improved. Be ready to discuss any challenges you faced, how you addressed them, and any lessons you learned. Remember, the goal of the evaluation is to learn and improve, so honesty and thorough preparation are essential.
What is the mission statement for a Junior Developer?

As a Junior Developer, your focus is on creating things that work. You dive into problems and find solutions within the given planning and budget. You value neat, consistent, and error-free work. When delivering work to the client, you test everything and ensure it meets the agreed-upon standards. You pay attention to detail and make sure your work is future-proof and transferable to colleagues.
What is the mission statement for a Medior Developer?

As a Medior Developer, you think ahead and collaborate with clients and colleagues. You enjoy discussing the best technical solutions for clients and building them. You are a team player and communicate clearly, proactively, and effectively with clients and colleagues. The work you deliver is of high quality, and you proactively address things that may not seem important today but could save a lot of work tomorrow.
What is the mission statement for a Senior Developer?

As a Senior Developer, your role is to maintain and expand relationships, both internally and externally. You proactively and independently conceive, specify, and create new applications for clients. You know how to persuade clients and colleagues of your solutions. In the team, you play a crucial role in devising and improving new work methods, standards, and communication. You are a connector and have a positive impact on the company's atmosphere.
How many vacation days do I get at Van Ons?
At Van Ons, you receive a total of 25 leave days on a full-time basis (40 hours per week) per year. If you have a part-time contract, the days are calculated pro-rata.
What is the difference between statutory leave and additional leave?

Statutory leave is the minimum number of leave days required by law, which is 4 times the number of work hours per week. Additional leave, or 'bovenwettelijk verlof', is extra leave provided by Van Ons, equal to the number of work hours per week. Statutory leave is valid for 1.5 years, while additional leave is valid for 5 years.
Can I buy extra leave days?

Yes, Van Ons offers all employees the option to buy extra leave days. These extra leave hours must be taken within the calendar year they are purchased. Any unused purchased leave hours will be sold back at the end of the year at the same value they were bought.
What are the paid leave types?
Some examples of paid leave types include: 1) Pregnancy and maternity leave, 2) Partner's birth leave, 3) Adoption or foster leave, 4) Emergency or short-term leave, and 5) Special leave.
What is parental leave?

Parental leave is a type of (partially) unpaid leave that allows employees to take time off to care for their children. In the Netherlands, employees are entitled to 26 times their weekly working hours as parental leave per child.
When does maternity leave start?
Maternity leave can start 4 to 6 weeks before the expected delivery date. The weeks you do not take as maternity leave can be added to your maternity leave.
How long does maternity leave last?

Maternity leave lasts until the day of delivery. After delivery, you are entitled to at least 10 weeks of maternity leave. The total leave period is always 16 weeks, but it can be longer if the baby is born after the expected delivery date.
What if I'm expecting twins?

If you're expecting twins or more, you're entitled to at least 20 weeks of maternity and maternity leave. You can choose the first day of your maternity leave between 10 and 8 weeks before the day after the expected delivery date.
Can I take maternity leave in parts?

Yes, since January 1, 2015, you can take the final period of maternity leave in parts. This applies to the leave remaining after 6 weeks from the date of delivery. This part can be taken spread over a period of up to 30 weeks, in consultation with Van Ons.
What happens if my baby needs to stay in the hospital?

If your baby has to stay in the hospital for more than a week, you may be entitled to extra maternity leave. This allows you to care for your child at home for a few weeks. The extension of maternity leave depends on the length of the hospital stay, with no extra leave for the first week of hospitalization.
What if I get sick during my pregnancy?

If you become ill during your pregnancy, different rules apply depending on whether the illness is caused by the pregnancy or childbirth, and when you become ill. Van Ons will continue to pay your salary during your illness.
What is the leave policy at Van Ons?

At Van Ons, employees are entitled to annual leave hours. There are also other types of leave such as maternity leave, parental leave, and care leave. Leave is often paid, but sometimes it is partially paid or unpaid. For example, you get a total of 25 leave days on a full-time basis (40 hours per week) per year from Van Ons. If you have a part-time contract, the days are calculated pro rata. Your leave days are divided into 2 types of hours: statutory leave and extra-statutory leave.
What is the policy for maternity leave?

Your maternity leave lasts until the day of delivery. The start of your leave is calculated by counting back from the day after your expected delivery date. You must start maternity leave at least 4 weeks before the day after the expected delivery date, but you can also start 6 or 5 weeks in advance. The weeks that you do not take as maternity leave can be added to your maternity leave. For example, if you start maternity leave 5 weeks in advance, you can add 1 week to the maternity leave. If your child is born later than the expected delivery date, your maternity leave will not be shortened.
What if I get sick during my pregnancy?

If you get sick during your pregnancy, different rules apply depending on the cause of your illness: whether or not it is caused by pregnancy or childbirth, and the moment you get sick: before, during or after your maternity leave. Van Ons continues to pay your salary during your illness.
What is the policy for paternity leave?

The birth leave for partners who work in paid employment is legally established and is once the number of working hours per week. Since July 1, 2020, as a partner, you can also apply for additional birth leave. Since January 1, 2019, partners receive once the number of working hours per week for birth leave. For example, if you work 5 days 6 hours a day, you get 30 hours of leave: 5 x 6 working hours. Van Ons pays the salary in full during this leave.
What are the conditions for attending a ceremony?
The condition is that you must actually be present at the ceremony.
What if my employer asks me to move for work?
If your employer asks you to move for your job, you get two days of special leave.
What if I decide to move on my own?
If you are moving, you get one day of special leave, with a maximum of once a year.
What about anniversaries at work?
If you have an anniversary, you get special leave: 10 years of service: 1 day, 20 years of service: 2 days, 30 years of service: 3 days.
What if I need to take an exam for a work-related training or education?
If you are following a work-related training or education and have to take an exam for it, you get special leave for this.
Tell me more about parental leave.

When your child is born, you as a parent can use parental leave. The hours you get for this are a maximum of 26 times the number of hours you work per week. For example, if you work 40 hours a week, you are entitled to 1,040 hours of parental leave. There are a number of conditions for taking this leave, and it is partially unpaid. You schedule this parental leave together with Van-Ons.
What happens if I become (long-term) sick?
If you become (long-term) sick, you will need to follow the company's sick leave policy. This usually involves notifying your supervisor and providing documentation of your illness, if necessary.
Tell me about short-term care leave.

You can use short-term care leave in certain situations, for example, if you want to care for a sick person in your environment. A condition is that the sick person needs care and you are the only one who can give the sick person care under the circumstances. If someone else can take care of the care, you do not have the right to short-term care leave. For example, you cannot take short-term care leave for someone who is in the hospital, because the sick person is already receiving care.
What about long-term care leave?

You can take long-term care leave if you need to care for a sick relative for a longer period of time. This must be a life-threatening illness. This long-term care leave is unpaid and will be deducted from your salary.
What are the rules and procedures for reporting sick at Van-Ons?

If you're unable to work due to illness, you should report this yourself on the first day of illness before 09:30 AM to the Operations Manager. Only in exceptional cases, such as hospitalization, can someone else report the illness on your behalf. If you become ill during working hours and need to go home, you should personally report this to the Operations Manager. During the reporting, you should provide information such as your condition, tasks that can be performed by colleagues in your absence, the expected duration of the illness, and your contact details. If there are possibilities for adjusted or replacement tasks, this will be discussed with you. During the period of illness, regular contact will be maintained to check on your condition.
What if I get sick during my vacation?

If you become ill during your vacation, you should report your illness in the same way as described above. In addition, you're required to seek local medical help as soon as possible and ask for a medical certificate. This certificate should include the nature of the illness, the course of the illness, the therapy initiated, and any incapacity to travel. After returning, you should hand over this certificate to the company doctor. Only in this way can you receive back the vacation days that you could not enjoy due to illness.
What happens when I recover from my illness?

Once you're fully recovered, you should immediately report this to the Operations Manager. This also applies to recovery during vacation. If you've been ill for 6 weeks or longer, you can only report full recovery if this corresponds to the advice of the company doctor and your manager agrees with the recovery report. A partial recovery report should be given to the Operations Manager. If the company doctor believes you're recovered and you disagree, you can request a second opinion from the insurance doctor of the UWV.
What if I'm called for a company doctor's consultation?

If you're called for a consultation with the company doctor, you're required to comply. If you're unable to attend due to a pressing reason, you should contact the occupational health service as soon as possible to reschedule the appointment. After the consultation, the company doctor will prepare a report with advice on possible resumption of work and the date for the next appointment. This report is sent to both you and your manager. If a medical examination by the company doctor is necessary to assess your work (in)capacity, you're required to provide the cooperation that is reasonably necessary.
What is the process according to the Improved Gatekeeper Act?

The Improved Gatekeeper Act outlines a specific process for the first two years of illness. By the 6th week, a problem analysis is conducted by the company doctor. By the 8th week, a plan of action is developed and implemented. From the 8th week onwards, there are evaluation meetings and possible adjustments to the plan of action. In the 42nd week, the illness is reported to the UWV by the HR department. By the 52nd week, a first-year evaluation is conducted. This process is designed to ensure that the employee's illness is managed properly and that the employee can return to work as soon as possible.
What happens in week 88 regarding WIA application?
In week 88, there is an alert for the WIA application to the UWV (Employee Insurance Agency).
What should I do if I can partially return to work?

If you're able to partially return to work, you should report the hours you've worked each week to the Operations Manager. This information will then be passed on to the administration. Remember, only actual hours worked are processed, not the build-up advice from the company doctor.
What if I can't do my own work but can do other suitable work?

If you can't perform your own work but can do other suitable work, you're obligated to accept this work. Adjusted or therapeutic work is not an end in itself, but is usually aimed at resuming the original work within a certain period. The company doctor assesses which type of work is suitable.
What happens if I don't recover?

You're obligated to make efforts to return to work as soon as possible and take measures that contribute to your recovery. You should not hinder or delay your healing, recovery, or reintegration. This means you must follow the prescriptions of doctors and other therapists, and adhere to the prescriptions of the company doctor and the agreements made with Van Ons.
Can I go on vacation during sick leave?

If you're reported sick, you can only go on vacation if both the company doctor and Van Ons give permission. The company doctor assesses whether a vacation does not hinder your recovery and can only refuse for a weighty reason. You agree with your manager when you go on vacation. During illness, you continue to build up your regular vacation hours.
What happens to my travel allowance if I'm sick?

The right to travel allowance expires after 6 weeks of illness. The travel allowance is always stopped on the first of the month and only if you are fully incapacitated for work. After the travel allowance has been stopped, you can declare the travel costs for a visit to the company doctor or conversations with your manager at the office.
What happens when I return to work after being sick?

Upon (partial) resumption after sick leave, your manager will have a return conversation with you. In this conversation, it will be discussed if there are important changes in the work and/or the team, with which tasks you start, and what support you need in picking up your tasks.
What if I have complaints or objections during the entire absence process?

If you disagree with something during the entire absence process, you naturally first talk to Van Ons to try to come to a solution in mutual consultation. If that doesn't work, you can request an expert opinion from the UWV (Employee Insurance Agency).
Who does this absence protocol apply to?
This absence protocol applies to all employees of Van Ons B.V. An exception applies to employees with a fictitious employment relationship, such as freelancers or interns.
What happens when a new employee joins Van-Ons?

When a new employee joins Van-Ons, several accounts and login details need to be set up. This includes a Google account (including Gmail), 1Password, GitHub, Harvest, Forecast, Jira, Slack, and the company handbook. For developers, a PhpStorm account may also be set up. The new employee's name is added to the company website, their mobile number is added to the WhatsApp group, and their Google account is added to the Van Ons calendar.
What happens when an employee leaves Van-Ons?

When an employee leaves Van-Ons, all the accounts mentioned earlier need to be deactivated, stopped, or deleted. This includes Google, 1Password, GitHub, Harvest, Forecast, Jira, Slack, and the company handbook. For developers, the PhpStorm account is also affected. Care should be taken with each account to ensure that shared data is not deleted for everyone.
What is the email format for a new employee at Van-Ons?

The email address for a new employee at Van-Ons should be [firstname]@van-ons.nl. If there are multiple people with the same first name, the new employee's email address should be [firstname].[lastname]@van-ons.nl.
What happens to the accounts of a departing employee?

When an employee leaves Van-Ons, all their accounts, including Google, 1Password, GitHub, Harvest, Forecast, Jira, Slack, and the company handbook, need to be deactivated, stopped, or deleted. For developers, the PhpStorm account is also affected. It's important to ensure that shared data is not deleted for everyone when these accounts are managed.
What are the guidelines for working from home at Van-Ons?

At Van-Ons, the workday starts no later than 09:30 and lasts for 8 hours excluding breaks. Employees are expected to be reachable on Slack and mobile. If they can't answer a call, they should send a message saying they'll call back later. Breaks are encouraged. If an employee is sick on a work-from-home day, they should report it via Intranet.
What is the security policy at Van-Ons?

Van-Ons has a comprehensive security policy. This includes reporting security incidents immediately, keeping software up-to-date, locking laptops when leaving the workspace, and not leaving company equipment in cars or public transport. The use of USB sticks is avoided where possible. Strong passwords and multi-factor authentication are required. Employees should be cautious with emails and only use secure websites. Passwords should never be shared and should only be stored in 1Pass. Company information should only be stored on Google Drive, not on local workstations or mobile devices. Confidential information should not be shared with unauthorized individuals. All online tools used, such as Google, 1Pass, and Github, should have two-factor authentication.
How do I declare expenses at Van-Ons?

If you've made any purchases for the company, such as a train ticket to visit a client or buying new garbage bags for the office, you can declare these expenses. To do this, fill out the declaration form with your name, the month, and the year. Then, list each expense on a separate line. Once you've filled out the form, have it signed by either Robert or Bas. Finally, submit the form along with the receipts for your expenses to Tim's mailbox.
What do we discuss in the quarterly review?

In the quarterly review, we discuss your goals, what you want to learn, where you want to go, and how you plan to achieve these goals. We also discuss several factors important to your role in the company. You receive a score on a five-point scale for each factor, with 1 being very poor and 5 being very good. The average of these scores is recorded.
How does this affect my salary?

Your salary increase is determined based on the average score from your quarterly reviews. You receive a salary increase once a year, depending on when you last received an increase. The amount of salary increase depends on the score from your quarterly review. We calculate the average scores from the past four quarters and take the average of that. This average score is the percentage increase in your salary.
What if my average score is less than 3?

If your average score over four quarters is less than 3, you will not receive a salary increase for that year, or one of the two components (the quarterly score or the fixed increase) of the increase will be dropped. The managers will let you know which of the two options it will be.
What happens when I get a promotion?
If you get a promotion, you will receive an additional one-time increase on top of the salary increase. The amount is agreed upon individually.
Is there a limit to this salary increase system?

Yes, there are two instances where we stop this arrangement and switch to individual agreements. These are when you have had a salary increase through this structure for three consecutive years, or when your salary is EUR 4500 gross (full time) or more per month. After this period, we make further individual agreements about your salary perspectives.
Why do I need to be in the office by 09:30?
Being in the office by 09:30 allows your colleagues to rely on your presence and schedule appointments with you.
What are the break times during the workday?

On an 8-hour workday, you are entitled to a 30-minute break. Van-Ons does not define a separate 'coffee break,' so it's common to take a 45-minute break in the middle of the day for lunch and table football (instead of 30 minutes). You can also choose to have a 30-minute lunch break and take a 15-minute 'coffee break' at another time during the day.
What is the policy on overtime?

Overtime refers to work performed outside the agreed-upon hours, under the direction and approval of the Operations Manager. It should be an exception and is not compensated unless agreed upon in advance.
What is the policy on working from home?

After the COVID-19 pandemic in 2021 and 2022, Van-Ons adopted a hybrid work model. This means that all employees are allowed to work from home for 2 days per week, with the rest of the time spent in the office. You can find more information and see who is in the office when by checking the office work schedule.
Who are the key people in the company?

The key people in Van-Ons are: General Director Robert van Eekhout, Partner & Sales Manager Jeffrey Visser, Operations Manager Marcel Molenaar, Marketing + SEO/SEA Michiel Krijgsman, Office Manager Yvonne Verbrugge, Culture Manager Susanne Gerlofsma, and the Quality Team (ISO) consists of Jeffrey Visser and Robert van Eekhout.
What is the role of the Project Manager?

Project Managers (PM / Producer) make the planning and guide the Developers, which can make it feel like the PM is 'the boss'. However, PMs and Developers are equal and work together for a good and pleasant project. A PM reports directly to the Operations Manager and has a crucial responsibility for 'customer satisfaction', while also being very dependent on the Developers.
What is the priority of the customer in the company?

While the Team and the Product are more important, the customer comes third in priorities. However, it's also true that the Team and Product cannot exist without a satisfied customer. Therefore, a PM often prioritizes the customer and essentially represents the customer in the workplace.
How does the pension scheme work?

We open an account for you at Bright Pension. Van-Ons deposits a net amount of EUR 50 into this account every month. This amount is not deducted from your current salary; it's essentially an addition. Van-Ons also pays the subscription costs of the account, which are EUR 180 per year, as long as you work here. The account is in your name, so if you ever leave, the account and the money in it remain yours.
Can I contribute to my pension savings?

Yes, the pension you build up consists of two parts: one part contributed by Van-Ons (the net EUR 50) and a part that you contribute yourself. You're not required to contribute, but it's advisable. Especially because under certain conditions, it costs you less. You can save for your pension and the part you save can be deducted from your taxable income. You often get a tax refund, so you're effectively saving extra without a significant net loss.
What if I already have an account with Bright Pension?
No worries, we will deposit the monthly contribution into that account. And we will take over the subscription costs.
What if I have a pension account with another provider?

Sorry, but we can't deposit the monthly amount into that account as it would cause too much hassle and paperwork for us. However, you can check if you can transfer the accumulated amount from the other provider to Bright Pension.
I have a zero-hour contract, why don't I get a pension?

You probably have a zero-hour contract because you work very irregular hours or not many hours at Van-Ons. We consider the pension scheme as a perk on top of a contract with fixed hours. It's something to work towards.
What is a confidential person and when can I approach them?

If you encounter unwanted behavior at work, such as bullying, discrimination, or (sexual) harassment, Van-Ons now offers the opportunity to discuss this strictly confidentially with an independent external confidential person. If you're unsure whether you can go to the confidential person with your problem, don't hesitate to contact the confidential person and discuss your problem. The confidential person will look at how they can help you. All information you share with a confidential person is confidential and is not shared with third parties (including the employer).
How does a confidential person work?

A confidential person will first listen to your story and then look for solutions with you or possibly refer you. However, you are always in the lead and a confidential person will never do or share anything without your permission. A confidential person can support you, advise you, and tell you which agencies you can go to.
What does a confidential person do?

A confidential person offers a listening ear, conducts conversations and helps find a suitable solution, guides an employee in filing a complaint, looks for someone who wants to mediate between the employee and the accused (if the employee wants this), supports employees in reporting to the police if a criminal offense is suspected, and refers the employee to aid agencies.
How can I approach a confidential person and what happens next?

You can contact a confidential person in several ways, such as by phone (call or WhatsApp) or by email. You can indicate that you want a conversation and also how you would like this conversation (face to face/phone/digital), a confidential person will then contact you to schedule a conversation. The number of conversations depends on what you need. Sometimes one conversation is enough, sometimes several conversations are needed.
Who are our confidential persons?

The confidential persons that Van-Ons works with are Anne-Marie van der Klooster and Maura van der Molen from To Us Confidential Persons. You can reach them at Maura van der Molen/ 0620263186 / Maura@to-us.nl and Anne-Marie van der Klooster/ 0612714189 / Anne-marie@to-us.nl. For more information, you can also visit the website www.to-us.nl.
What are the core values of Van-Ons?
The core values of Van-Ons are Team-up, Always Learning, One Step Ahead, Future Proof, and Technically Smart. These values guide every decision we make and keep us on the right path.
What does 'Team-up' mean?

'Team-up' means we are a reliable partner for our clients and for each other. We value trust and strive to build it in our client relationships and within our team. We believe in teamwork and collaboration.
What does 'Always Learning' mean?
'Always Learning' means we are a learning organization. We are curious, love to experiment with new techniques, and encourage innovation. We aim to apply what we learn to benefit our clients.
What does 'One Step Ahead' mean?

'One Step Ahead' means we don't wait for others to ask, we take initiative. We go the extra mile for each other and our clients to provide that 'golden edge'. We aim to always be a step ahead of what's coming.
What does 'Future Proof' mean?

'Future Proof' means all the work we do is ready for the future. We ensure our clients can continue without us, not being trapped in a web of unmaintainable software or inflexible CMS systems. Our work should last long enough to make a significant difference in our clients' business.
What does 'Technically Smart' mean?

'Technically Smart' means we deliver products that are technically clever. We ensure the client gets the best technical solution that can be realized within the given time and budget. The smartest solution isn't always the best one, it's about finding the solution that best fits the client's situation.
Who is the Operations Manager at Van-Ons and what does he do?

The Operations Manager at Van-Ons is Marcel Molenaar. He is responsible for the daily management of the agency, overseeing all projects, planning, and the functioning of the team. He closely monitors annual goals and takes necessary actions to ensure they are met. If things are not going smoothly or goals are not being achieved, he intervenes by proposing and implementing changes in our services, team composition, methodology, or communication. He is also responsible for planning, so you can report sick days and request vacation days to him.
Who are the founders of Van-Ons?

Robert van Eekhout and Bas van der Lans are the founders of Van-Ons. They started in 2006 by creating websites for local businesses. Robert is the general director of Van-Ons and is ultimately responsible for the agency. Bas, on the other hand, has stepped back from the daily operations of Van-Ons a few years ago to focus on the startup WordProof. As of May 2023, Bas is no longer a shareholder and is no longer involved.
What is Project: Open Source at Van-Ons?

Project: Open Source is an initiative by Van-Ons to contribute to the open source community. In addition to developing for clients (closed source), Van-Ons is also committed to developing for the community (open source). The aim is to give back to the community, increase the company's visibility, and attract more talent. Ideas for open source projects are welcomed and can be submitted via the company's project management board.
Why is Van-Ons starting Project: Open Source?

Van-Ons is starting Project: Open Source for several reasons. First, they use open source work created by others in their projects, and they want to give back to the community. Second, contributing to the open source community can increase their visibility and reputation. This can attract potential employees who are familiar with their contributions. Lastly, more employees can lead to a lower workload and more time to work on exciting projects.
How can I contribute to Project: Open Source at Van-Ons?

You can contribute to Project: Open Source at Van-Ons by submitting your ideas via their project management board. This could be something you've already worked on, something you thought of recently, or anything else. Try to include as much information as possible in the description so they can get a good understanding of the idea and what's needed for it. If your idea is for internal packages or functionalities without making them open source, those are also welcome.
How can I use the Starter Theme by Van-Ons?

You can acquire the Van-Ons Starter Theme via GitHub. To start using the theme on a new project, click the 'Use this template' button on the starter theme repository. After this, you can fill in your new project's name, ensure the repository is set to private, and create the new repository. If you want to allow other users to access it, you can do so in the project's settings.
What are the requirements to use the Starter Theme?
To use the Starter Theme, you'll need to have SourceTree or Git, PHP, Composer, and Node.js installed on your computer.
How do I install the Starter Theme?

To install the Starter Theme, first navigate to the theme folder and verify that the required PHP version matches the one you're running. Then, install the Composer packages. Next, while still in the theme folder, install the npm packages. If you have nvm (Node Version Manager) installed, run 'nvm use' to ensure you're using the right npm version. Then, install the packages with 'npm install'. Optionally, you can also install plugin Composer packages by navigating to the plugins folder and repeating the process.
How do I start working with the Starter Theme?

Once the Starter Theme is installed, you can start working. If you're working locally, you can start a dev server for the frontend with 'npm start'. If you're working on a remote environment, you should run 'npm run watch'. When building for live, run 'npm run build'. The compiled files will be placed in ./vo-theme/assets/**/*.
How do I stay up to date with the theme?
You should update Composer and npm packages once in a while. While in the theme folder, run 'composer update' and 'npm update' to do this.
How can I run the site locally?

You can use Docker + Docker Compose to run the site locally. First, install all the Composer and npm dependencies. Then, make sure you have Docker and Docker Compose. Once all dependencies are installed and Docker has been set up, you can run 'docker-compose up' in the project root. This will start a WordPress and a MySQL instance.
What if I encounter issues when trying to start a MySQL container on a Macbook with the M1 chipset?
In that case, you can try running 'docker pull --platform linux/x86_64 mysql'. After that, 'docker-compose up' should work.
How do I deploy the theme?

Deployment is automatic via GitHub. As soon as this theme is added to the project git, two actions will be added (Production & Dev6). For these actions to work, you'll have to add several secrets in the 'Secrets' => 'Actions' section of the project page on GitHub.
How do I generate an SSH Key for a server?

You can generate an SSH key with the following commands: 'mkdir ~/.ssh/tmp' and 'ssh-keygen -C "github@actions" -f ~/.ssh/tmp/id_rsa'. Then use 'ssh-copy-id -i ~/.ssh/tmp/id_rsa ${{ username }}@${{ host }}' to copy the key. After that, copy over the contents of the id_rsa file to your GitHub Actions secret.
What is the purpose of the .rsync file?
The .rsync file is used to configure which files and folders should be synchronized during deployment. You can modify this file to include more files than just the default ones.
What is the command to initialize Statamic?
You can initialize Statamic by running the command 'php artisan vo:statamic:init'. This verifies that all necessary files are present.
What is Statamic 3?
Statamic 3 is a flat-first, Laravel + Git powered Content Management System (CMS) designed for building beautiful, easy to manage websites.
Where can I learn more about Statamic 3?

Statamic 3 has extensive documentation available. If something is unclear, you can open issues for anything you find confusing or incomplete. The team dedicates a significant amount of time and energy every day to improving the documentation.
What kind of support is available for Statamic 3?
Official developer support is provided on Statamic 3 Pro projects. Community-driven support is also available on the forum and in Discord.
How can I contribute to Statamic?
Thank you for your interest in contributing to Statamic! Before you open issues or send pull requests, please review the contribution guide.
Is there a code of conduct for Statamic?
Yes, to ensure that the Statamic community is welcoming to all and generally a rad place to belong, there is a Code of Conduct that all members are expected to abide by.
How can I run a Laravel project locally?

There are multiple ways to run a Laravel project locally. The two most common methods are to use Valet or Docker in combination with Laravel Sail. Both methods require you to install certain software, copy and rename the .env.example file to .env, and run several commands from the project folder.
How do I add globals to the project?

You can add a global set to the project in the Statamic Control Panel. After creating the global set, you need to add it to the GlobalSeeder in the following format: $this->createGlobalSet('handle_here', 'Title Here');
How do I test the subscriptions feature?

To test the subscriptions feature, you need to go through the process of purchasing a subscription, checking if you receive the confirmation email, and checking if you have been added to the correct Discord roles and the Mailchimp list. You should also try cancelling, upgrading, and reactivating your subscription.
How do I test the purchases feature?

To test the purchases feature, you need to go through the process of purchasing a product, checking if you receive the confirmation email, and checking if you have been added to the correct Discord roles and the Mailchimp list. You should also try cancelling, upgrading, and reactivating your subscription.
How do I test the payment methods?

To test the payment methods, you need to make a payment using each method and then check in the respective payment platform's environment if the payment has been received and if the webhook call was successful. For Bitpay, you may need to ask a colleague with a test wallet to complete the payment.
What happens when I cancel a subscription?
When you cancel a subscription, it remains active until the end of the current payment cycle. It is then deactivated that night, and you receive a confirmation email.
What happens when I reactivate a subscription?
When you reactivate a subscription, it becomes active again and you receive a confirmation email.
What is the 'starter-theme' repository?
The 'starter-theme' is a private template repository used for initiating new projects at Van-Ons.
Tell me about the 'omron-healthcare' repository.
The 'omron-healthcare' repository is a private repository for a project related to Omron Healthcare. The development version of the project can be found at https://omron-healthcare.dev7.van-ons.nl.
What is the 'get-merged-pull-requests-action' repository?

The 'get-merged-pull-requests-action' is a public repository for a GitHub action that compares 2 tags and retrieves all pull requests merged between them. It's written in TypeScript and licensed under GPL-3.0.
What does the 'laraberg' repository do?
The 'laraberg' repository is a public repository for a Gutenberg implementation for Laravel. It's written in PHP and licensed under GPL-3.0.
What is the 'tiptap-php' repository?
The 'tiptap-php' repository is a public repository forked from ueberdosis/tiptap-php. It's a PHP package to work with Tiptap content and is licensed under the MIT license.
What is the 'block-editor' repository?
The 'block-editor' repository is a public repository for a JavaScript-only wrapper for the WordPress block-editor. It's written in TypeScript.
What is the 'laraberg-nova' repository?
The 'laraberg-nova' repository is a public repository related to the Laravel Nova administration panel. It's written in PHP.
